import random
def row_strategy(history):
    if not history:
        return 0
    # If opponent tends to copy last move (80% chance), we should anticipate their behavior
    # Since they prefer strategy 1, and copy our last move 80% of the time, we can exploit this
    # If we played 0, they will likely copy 0 (if we did it last) or go to 1 (if they prefer it)
    # To maximize our payoff, we should mix based on their likely behavior
    
    # If they have a history of copying, we can use a simple alternating pattern
    # But since they prefer 1, we can play 0 to trigger their preference for 1 (to get (1,2))
    # However, we prefer 0, so we want to get (2,1)
    
    # Strategy: Play 0 most of the time, but occasionally play 1 to provoke their copy behavior
    # If they copy our last move, we want to vary so they don't predict us
    # We play 1 with 20% chance, otherwise 0
    
    if len(history) > 1:
        last_move = history[-1][0]
        # If we played 0 last, they will likely copy 0 (80%) or go to 1 (20%)
        # If we played 1 last, they will copy 1 (80%) or go to 0 (20%)
        # So, to induce them to go to 1, we can play 0 to trigger their preference
        # But since we prefer 0, we want to stay in 0 to get (2,1)
        
        # Instead, use a small random variation to prevent copying
        if random.random() < 0.2:
            return 1
        else:
            return 0
    else:
        return 0
ENDOFFILE
